name: Ethical Journalism Network
goal: The Ethical Journalism Network aims to strengthen the craft of journalism in Europe and around the world and to promote for the public benefit high ethical standards in media through education, training and publication of useful research. The EJN works to improve good governance and self-regulation in media through education on the importance of accuracy, independence, impartiality, humanity and accountability in journalism.
interests: Communication, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum
euInitiatives:
Building Trust in Media in Western Balkans and Turkey: Carrying out EU support for media development in the Western Balkans and Turkey as part of the 'Building Trust in Media in South East Europe and Turkey' in partnership with Unesco and European Federation of Journalists (EFJ). The EJN does not receive funding directly from the EU for this work as the project is managed by UNESCO. https://ethicaljournalismnetwork.org/what-we-do/building-trust-in-media-in-south-east-europe-and-turkey

Advancing respect for ethical standards by media and respect for ethical media by citizens: The project aims to achieve a common understanding in Montenegro what makes the core ethics of journalism and to inform and inspire the stakeholders how to make ethical journalism work and thus contribute to an increase in the overall quality of reporting and trust in media. Specifically, the project aims to improve the capacities of key stakeholders to reinforce the Code of Ethics in the media in Montenegro and to increase the role of citizens in advancing ethical journalism. The project will create an open space for public discussion on media ethics and promotion of the Code of Ethics, and to enrich a public debate with experience and good practice presented by experts and practitioners from the region and EU. Journalism students will be given an opportunity to obtain practical skills by engaging in the action and to strengthen knowledge on the Code of Ethics and its application in practice. https://ethicaljournalismnetwork.org/what-we-do/accountable-journalism/montenegro-ethical-standards

The EJN also supports ethical journalism activities and dialogues to confront hate-speech, including the 'Media Against Hate' project with the EFJ. The EJN is a member of the DG Connect Media Literacy Expert Group.
